td.content: s:a female doctor aged 37 ys presents with hearing or seeing things that aren't there x 3 days. pt also complains of vivid flashbacks, overwhelming feelings of guilt, Mental Health. she denies smoking Patient is a moderate drinker o:Height 69 in, Weight 152 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 88, SystolicBP 103, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 14, C-SSRS (Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale) (-) Moderate lethality, distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt a:vivid flashbacks. patient presents with symptoms of depression but does not appear to be danger to self at this time. p:administered Wellbutrin - 300 mg daily, performed C-SSRS (Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale), and performed Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation with medical services - Completed, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:Patient was seen at ER due to depressed mood and agitation. o:Height 69 in, Weight 153 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 88, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 15, Special screening for other specified conditions (+) moderate depression per BDI Screen (27), avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent a:intense nightmares p:Patient adjusting well to medication.

td.content: s:a female aged 39 years complained of vivid flashbacks, overwhelming feelings of guilt and hearing or seeing things that aren't there. patient denied any fall or trauma. NKDA. she denies smoking describes drinking an average of 12 beers a week for about 2 years in her past o:Height 70 in, Weight 159 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 17, C-SSRS (Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale) (-) Moderate lethality, distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt a:vivid flashbacks. patient presents with symptoms of depression but does not appear to be danger to self at this time. p:administered Prozac - 40 mg daily, performed C-SSRS (Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale), and performed Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation with medical services - Completed, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.
